intro: Maesobotrya floribunda var. schweinfurthii, commonly known as the Schweinfurth's maesobotrya, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
